LanguageData.ALConfigCuriosityEatingLabel: Prevent animals from eating random stuff
LanguageData.ALConfigCuriosityEatingTooltip: It mostly prevents your animals from eating drugs without a nutrition and stuff outside their allowed zones. They would still eat your food if it is in their allowed zone.
LanguageData.ALConfigHostilePredatorsLabel: Predators hunting your pawns are considered hostile by your entire faction
LanguageData.ALConfigHostilePredatorsTooltip: This does not change threat response of your pawns, it only makes them able to recognize a threat.
LanguageData.ALConfigEggConversionLabel: Convert eggs ruined by temperature into unfertilized chicken eggs
LanguageData.ALConfigEggConversionTooltip: This does not affect already ruined eggs.
LanguageData.ALConfigMeatConversionLabel: Convert any generic animal meat into chicken meat upon butchering
LanguageData.ALConfigMeatConversionTooltip: This does not affect already butchered meat.
LanguageData.ALConfigMedicalAlertsTooltip: Shows right-hand alerts for when colony animals are injured, need rescuing or in critical medical condition.
LanguageData.ALConfigTamenessDecayThresholdLabel: Wildness threshold for tameness decay {0}%. Vanilla: 10.1%.
LanguageData.ALConfigTamenessDecayThresholdTooltip: Set to 100% to prevent losing tameness for all animals.
LanguageData.ALConfigTrainingDecaySpeedFactorTooltip: Set to 1% to make it as slow as possible.
LanguageData.ALConfigTradeHintsLabel: Tags for animals in trade and caravan interfaces
LanguageData.ALConfigTradeHintsTooltip: Shows animal's sex, training and wool growth.
LanguageData.ALConfigAnimalsCanUseFoodDispenserLabel: Allow animals to use nutrient paste dispenser
LanguageData.ALConfigAnimalsCanUseFoodDispenserToolti: Animals would be capable of pressing that button. Warining: contains a minor detour (extremely unlikely chance to have a conflict). If animals still don't use the dispenser, check if the building iself is in the allowed area.
LanguageData.ALConfigHaulingMTBTooltip: 'MTB' stands for 'Mean Time Between'. Setting to 0 drastically increases productiveness, but can affect performance with large amount of trained animals.
LanguageData.ALConfigShowExtraDisplayStatsTooltip: Shows some stats that vanilla misses, like resource production.
LanguageData.ALConfigAlwaysShowRelationsTooltip: By default, only relations with named animals are displayed. This allows to see all of them.
LanguageData.Stat_Race_WoolType_Desc: The type of wool this creature will yield when sheared.
LanguageData.Stat_Race_WoolAmount_Desc: The amount of wool yielded when shearing this creature and time it takes to grow wool.
LanguageData.Stat_Race_MilkType_Desc: The type of milk this creature will yield when milked.
LanguageData.Stat_Race_MilkAmount_Desc: The amount of milk yielded when milking this creature and time it takes to produce milk.
LanguageData.MilkFemaleExplanation: Some species may produce milk regardless of sex, but for most only females can be milked.
LanguageData.Stat_Race_EggType_Desc: The type of eggs this creature will lay.
LanguageData.Stat_Race_EggAmount_Desc: The amount of eggs in a clutch and how long it takes to produce them.
LanguageData.EggFemaleExplanation: Some species may produce eggs regardless of sex, but for most only females can do that.
LanguageData.EggNeedFertilizationExplanation: Some species may produce unfertilized eggs, but many others would not.
LanguageData.EggIncubationExplanation: How much times it takes for an egg to hatch.
LanguageData.TimeToMatureExplanation: How much times it takes to reach reproductive age, age when it can produce milk/wool, or last defined life stage for species that can't reproduce. They are the same age for most species.
LanguageData.GestationPeriodExplanation: How much times it takes to produce a new offspring.
LanguageData.LitterSizeExplanation: How many offsprings can be produced at once.
LanguageData.AnimalNeedsTreatmentDesc: These animals need medical treatment. Without it, they may die of their wounds, or their wounds may become permanent.\n\n{0}
LanguageData.AnimalsNeedRescueDesc:
These animals are incapacitated on the ground:

{0}
Send a colonist to rescue them and carry them back to bed.

(To rescue, select a colonist, then right click on the victim and select Rescue.)
